results.title: Jardiwarnpa: a Warlpiri fire ceremony
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins, City Pictures, Warlpiri Media and Warlukurlangu Artists
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blood brothers (A)”.
In order to combat the influence of western culture the elders of the Warlpiri people, led by Darby Jampijinpa Ross, a noted Aboriginal artist, decided to perform a fire ceremony which tells the story of Yarripiri’s journey. Yarripiri is both a real person and an incarnation of a dreamtime spirit. This video documents the preparations for the ceremony, the ceremony itself, the story the ceremony recreates and the problems the people have in performing it. Narrated by Kev Carmody.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins, City Pictures, Warlpiri Media and Warlukurlangu Artists

results.title: Broken English
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins and City Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blood brothers (A)”.
In 1958, as a result of a forced confession, an inability to read or write English and the racial intolerance of the police and the community of the time, Rupert Max Stuart, an indigenous Australian man, was sentenced to hang for the rape and murder of a nine year old girl. Using dramatisation, archival film and interviews with those involved, including Stuart himself, this video charts the trial, appeals and subsequent attempts to overthrow the conviction.

results.title: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: A three part series in which John Pilger explores aspects of Australia’s history from first settlement, through its involvement in wars right through to today’s society, and looks at the plight of First Nations people throughout Australian history.
results.title_for_label: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Lowery, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)

group_works.title: Secrets
group_works.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)

results.title: Secrets
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
Part two of John Pilger’s personal view of Australian history and identity. This part is about the past catching up with the present. Behind the Bicentennial ballyhoo, the original Australians are treated as badly as many blacks in South Africa; and, for an increasing number of whites, the old egalitarian ways no longer have a place in a media conscious “lucky country” which now produces fine wines, films and thousands of overnight millionaires whilst many of its children are living in poverty.

group.title: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger
group.creator_credit: Alan Lowery, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)

results.title: Other people's wars
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
The final episode of a three part series which explores aspects of Australia’s history. This part shows how Australians fight mostly against people with whom they have no quarrel and who offer them no threat of invasion. From the Boxer Rebellion in China to the Boer War in Africa, to the disaster in Vietnam, Australians have paid a unique blood sacrifice to appease a great protector.

results.title: Alcheringa
results.brief_description: Bill Onus hosts this series of films on different aspects of the traditional lifestyle of Australian First Nations peoples.
results.description: Bill Onus hosts this series of films on different aspects of the traditional lifestyle of Australian First Nations peoples.

results.title: Woman gathers food
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alcheringa”.
To the women falls the task of collecting supplementary foods - such as witchetty grubs and yams. Use is made of a sharply pointed stick to dig under bark for grubs and to kill a lizard which wanders across their path; also to dig for yams. The daughter accompanies her mother on her daily walk and learns the art of food gathering.

results.title: Walkabout
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
An Aboriginal man and his wife undertake a pilgrimage to the sacred place of the Rainbow Serpent, the controller of rain, water and life on earth. They are shown walking to the coast through an uninhabited land, clambering down cliffs to the ocean. The man carries spears and always walks ahead. Their way of life in tribal times is clearly shown in this brief sequence, as the man carries two spears and walks ahead of his wife.

results.title: Trading
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Alcheringa”.
First Nations peoples from central and coastal districts trade their specialties among themselves, in particular weapons of the hunt and of war. Leaving his family at their inland mia-mia, a man travels through dense bush to barter with another, so that each may benefit from the other’s skills. They sit face to face and test each weapon for strength before returning with their new possessions. With Bill Onus.

results.title: Making a stone axe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alcheringa”.
Shows how Australia’s First Nations peoples lived hundreds of years ago. Tool making require both skill and patience. By means of grinding stones, the stone axe is shaped to the desired form.
